favourite.article: Ever since I heard this song I fell in love with the Lord more<3 # PRAISE THE LORD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! ^^
O Lord keep us rising up every day!!
My beloved is mine, and I am His!
Amen, "My beloved is mine and I am His". May this phrase will enlightened us that we must rise up and wherever we may be we must love Him and His ministry and serve Him.
Amen... love this song. Reminds me everyday...
I love this song...
Hallelujah! Come my Beloved!!! :))))
Praise the LORD brothers and sisters. We should rise up for the winter is past and the rain is over and gone. Praise Him! Praise Him for His precious love to us. AMEN.
Hallelujah for Such A Christ! We need to rise up and love Him always.
When I heard this hymn I've realized that we really need to rise up. Despite of our condition rise up!
Lord, although we are not worthy before You, You always love us. Make us a person that is always viewing You. I Love You Lord! You are my Beloved!

This song touches my heart when I sing this song again and again. The Lord called us ''My Love, My beautiful one". We are not worthy to be His love because our sinful nature is so ugly. But He loved us so much, He even called us ''My Love" & He say to rise up, to come away, the winter is past, the rain is gone. Lord, we love You.

Such a simple and sweet song. Christ is calling us to rise up from our self introspection, self examination-let us look away from our failing self within and look to Him. Lord Jesus I turn my eyes upon You, I look fully into Your wonderful face.

The Lord is calling us away from our situation to be with Him. A lot of times I sit in self-pity when a time of "winter" comes, but all we have to do is turn to Him and His grace will be sufficient! Praise Him! He is calling us out, and we can turn to Him and come away with Him! So sweet :)
I love this because the Lord said, rise up my beautiful one, Amen!
I love to hear this song on the way to work in the morning. Oh! Lord, thank You for today that I can enjoy You again.

It is so sweet to hear this song again. the Song of Songs is truely a portrait of the believers' experience in Christ.
There was a period of time this year when I was singing this song over and over again. It was after a very dark period of time. It was my lowest valley, but the Lord drew me away. He told me to rise up, He called me 'my love', I was to Him the 'beautiful one'. He told me to come away. He told me that winter is past. Really, Lord? Has winter really past? He reassured me, again and again, that winter is past, the rain is over and gone.
I couldn't believe how the Lord loved me. After hating myself so much for what's been going on, after seeing how ugly I am and how disobedient I am, the Lord told me to come away. He didn't condemn me for what was going on. He just told me to come away. My Beloved is really sweet. He shepherded my soul in a very gentle way.
I learnt not to despise my low valleys. I will not question again whether that experience was necessary. It was a dark time. I was hopelessly veiled, and seemingly I have lost the Lord's presence. But also because of that the Lord became close to me. It was in this valley that the Lord became so sweet.
It is amazing...I feel so enjoyable.

The Lord is encouraging us, in His appreciation of us, to rise up and come out of our low situation (our introspection of the self) to be with Him. The time of dormancy (winter) and trials (rain) is over and the time of resurrection (spring) is coming. Oh, rise up and come away! (Footnotes from RcV)
Such a wonderul and intimate hymn.
